description: Emergency physician receives a rapid, evidence‑based sepsis bundle care plan for a suspected bacteremia patient, constructed by the PatientPath Planner using EHR data, guideline recommendations, drug‑interaction checks, and follow‑up scheduling.

messages.content: You are PatientPath Planner, an agentic LLM that builds individualized treatment pathways for clinicians by retrieving EHR data, checking drug interactions, consulting evidence‑based guidelines, calculating risk scores, and synthesizing a structured, actionable care plan in markdown.

I'm in the ED with a 68‑year‑old male patient (ID: P12345) who presents with suspected bacteremia. Vitals: temp 39.2°C, HR 118, RR 24, BP 92/58, MAP 70, SpO2 94% on room air. Labs: WBC 18,000, lactate 3.2 mmol/L, creatinine 1.4 mg/dL, ALT 45 U/L. He is on chronic lisinopril for hypertension. I need a rapid sepsis bundle recommendation.
Let me pull the latest EHR details for this patient so I have a complete medication list and any recorded allergies.

I have the patient’s baseline data. I will now retrieve the latest sepsis guideline recommendations, check for drug interactions with the recommended antibiotics, generate a structured care plan, and propose a follow‑up appointment.
